about.p: OSCOM is an international, not-for-profit organization dedicated to Open Source Content Management.
The goal is to bring together as many great brains as possible to build a network and grow the community of open source content management.
We want to show the world that there are already great and easy-to-use open source content management solutions out there.

feature.title: Second Open Source Content Management Conference
feature.p: Due to the great success of the first conference we are organizing another conference at Berkeley, California from Wednesday, 25 September to Friday, 27 September 2002. For more details please see program. Looking forward to seeing you.

feature.title: First Open Source Content Management Conference
feature.p: The conference was a great success. More than a hundred people were attending. The conference was organized by wyona.org at the Swiss Federal Institute of Technology (ETH), Zürich, Switzerland. The presentations can be downloaded from here. Peace and respects to everyone who helped to organize and attended the conference.
